TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AndroidCharacter extends Java.Lang.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Runtime.Versioning.ObsoletedOSPlatform("android26.0", "This class is obsoleted in this android platform")]
[<System.Runtime.Versioning.ObsoletedOSPlatform("android26.0", "This class is obsoleted in this android platform")>]

Docs.summary: AndroidCharacter exposes some character properties that used to be not easily accessed from java.

remarks.para: AndroidCharacter exposes some character properties that used to be not easily accessed from java.lang.Character, but are now available in ICU.
This member is deprecated. Use various methods from android.icu.lang.UCharacter, instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Sub GetDirectionalities (src As Char(), dest As Byte(), count As Integer)
public: static void GetDirectionalities(cli::array <char> ^ src, cli::array <System::Byte> ^ dest, int count);
public static void GetDirectionalities (char[]? src, byte[]? dest, int count);
.method public static hidebysig void GetDirectionalities(char[] src, unsigned int8[] dest, int32 count) cil managed
static member GetDirectionalities : char[] * byte[] * int -> unit

Docs.summary: Fill in the first count bytes of dest with the directionalities from the first count chars of src.

remarks.para: Fill in the first count bytes of dest with the directionalities from the first count chars of src. This is just like Character.getDirectionality() except it is a batch operation.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function GetEastAsianWidth (input As Char) As Integer
.method public static hidebysig int32 GetEastAsianWidth(char input) cil managed

Docs.summary: Calculate the East Asian Width of a character according to Unicode TR#11.
Docs.returns: the East Asian Width for input

remarks.para: Calculate the East Asian Width of a character according to Unicode TR#11. The return will be one of #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_NEUTRAL, #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_AMBIGUOUS, #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_HALF_WIDTH, #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_FULL_WIDTH, #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_NARROW, or #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_WIDE.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Sub GetEastAsianWidths (src As Char(), start As Integer, count As Integer, dest As Byte())
public: static void GetEastAsianWidths(cli::array <char> ^ src, int start, int count, cli::array <System::Byte> ^ dest);
public static void GetEastAsianWidths (char[]? src, int start, int count, byte[]? dest);
.method public static hidebysig void GetEastAsianWidths(char[] src, int32 start, int32 count, unsigned int8[] dest) cil managed
static member GetEastAsianWidths : char[] * int * int * byte[] -> unit

Docs.param: character array of input to measure
first character in array to measure
maximum number of characters to measure
byte array of results for each character in src
Docs.summary: Fill the first count bytes of dest with the East Asian Width from count chars of src starting at start.

remarks.para: Fill the first count bytes of dest with the East Asian Width from count chars of src starting at start. East Asian Width is calculated based on Unicode TR#11. Each entry in dest will be one of #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_NEUTRAL, #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_AMBIGUOUS, #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_HALF_WIDTH, #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_FULL_WIDTH, #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_NARROW, or #EAST_ASIAN_WIDTH_WIDE.

format.a: Java documentation for android.text.AndroidCharacter.getEastAsianWidths(char[], int, int, byte[]).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Replace the specified slice of text with the chars' right-to-left mirrors (if any), returning true if any replacements were made.

remarks.para: Replace the specified slice of text with the chars' right-to-left mirrors (if any), returning true if any replacements were made.
